thread.title: Secret Service Director Announces He Will Retire In March
thread.title_full: Secret Service Director Announces He Will Retire In March

author: Jack Davis
title: Secret Service Director Announces He Will Retire In March
text:
Secret Service Director Announces He Will Retire In March "... tremendous job ..." Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
United States Secret Service Director Joseph Clancy has given notice to the White House that he will retire next month. 
Clancy, who had retired from the Secret Service in 2011, was summoned out of retirement by former President Barack Obama after a string of incidents tarnished the image of the Secret Service. Director Clancy was singled out for praise by Pres Trump at a WH event 2 days after the Inauguration. pic.twitter.com/u9gmadK1g3 
— Mark Knoller (@markknoller) February 14, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below Limbaugh: White House Leaks Are A Bigger Problem Than Flynn’s Phone Call 
Clancy, 70, joined the Secret Service in 1984. He was the head of Obama’s detail from 2009 to 2011 before retiring to join the private sector. 
House Oversight Chairman Jason Chaffetz praised Clancy for helping to repair “an agency plagued with mismanagement, misconduct and security lapses.” 
“Moving forward, I encourage President Trump to appoint a director from outside the agency. A fresh set of eyes and new perspective is needed to restore the prestige and status expected of such an elite agency,” Chaffetz said. Advertisement - story continues below 
The Washington Post published a list of possible replacements, which included George Mulligan, the current chief operating officer of the Secret Service, as well as former Clinton detail leader Larry Cockell; Mickey Nelson, a former assistant director; and the newly promoted deputy director, William Callahan. 
Clancy has said that all the presidents he has protected share similarities. 
“I don’t think any of them sleep very well,” he said. “They’re also very schedule-oriented. They all run on tight schedules,” adding that, “They’re all involved in athletics. Some enjoy golf, some enjoy running, some biking.” 
As for himself, “Everything keeps me up night,” he said in January, adding, “that’s our business.” Advertisement - story continues below
